projects.role: Frontend Engineer at Naver Financial (Oct 2024 - Present)

project1.title: Naver Financial - Corporate Employee Welfare Platform (Frontend Lead)

descriptions.0: Led the design and implementation of a SPA architecture using React Router Data APIs.
descriptions.1: Designed end-to-end authentication and error-handling flows between the BFF and frontend, including a custom error class–based domain exception framework.
descriptions.2: Established an asynchronous data loading structure using clientLoader and built a unified loading experience through Suspense integration.
descriptions.3: Reduced production bundle size by 30% and improved performance through lazy loading, dynamic module loading, request deduplication, and React Compiler optimizations.
descriptions.4: Built a complex form state management system using React Hook Form and Zod, including secure file signature verification.
descriptions.5: Improved production monitoring security and accuracy by applying Sentry integration with hidden sourcemaps.
descriptions.6: Established a type-safe API integration workflow using Swagger TypeScript API to improve developer productivity and backend consistency.
descriptions.7: Enhanced user experience by implementing client-side timeout handling and refetch strategies during BFF delays and gateway timeout scenarios.
descriptions.8: Implemented a Canary dark-release deployment strategy to replace the legacy Blue/Green process, enabling stable QA and progressive rollouts.

project2.title: Naver Financial - Customer Inquiry Portal (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Implemented the customer inquiry page with requirement-driven UI improvements.
descriptions.1: Improved mobile UI stability through cross-device testing.

project3.title: Naver Financial - Internal Admin Dashboard (Frontend Development, Sub Project)

descriptions.0: Developed internal admin dashboards using React and applied Jotai for state management.
descriptions.1: Integrated multiple BFF and backend APIs to support core features and ensure maintainable service interactions.

descriptions.0: Built a full-stack personal blog using Next.js 15 (App Router) and Supabase for authentication, storage, and database management.
descriptions.1: Handled login and post creation logic on the server using Next.js Server Actions.
descriptions.2: Implemented a custom Markdown editor and renderer based on MDX.
descriptions.3: Built a Tailwind CSS–based design system and improved UI details.
descriptions.4: Implemented protected route handling and server-side auth verification using Next.js Middleware.
descriptions.5: Enhanced login security by integrating CAPTCHA and applying Redis-based IP rate limiting to block bot and brute-force attacks.
descriptions.6: Built an i18n locale management structure and improved routing by integrating it with Middleware.
descriptions.7: Optimized asynchronous rendering and loading flows using Suspense to reduce UX delays.
